1.  Introduction 
 
Chemical reaction kinetics deals with the rates of chemical processes.   Any chemical process may 
be broken down into a sequence of one or more single-step processes known either as elementary 
processes, elementary reactions, or elementary steps.  Elementary reactions usua

concentration of N2, H2, or NH3.  Say we monitor N2, and obtain a rate of -d[N2]
dt  = x mol dm-3 s-1.  
Since for every mole of N2 that reacts, we lose three moles of H2, if we had monitored H2 instead of 
N2 we would have obtained a rate -d[H2]

To introduce the chemistry of the carbonyl functional groups.

Structure of Aldehydes and Ketones
•
The carbonyl carbon of an aldehyde or ketone is sp2-hybridized.
•
The bond angle is close to 120°  (trigonal planar).
•
The carbon-oxygen double bond consists of:
– A ! C-O bond
– A " C=O bond
We can compare the C=O bond length
to those of C=C double bonds
